wikipedia_page.main: Douglas Gordon Doug Wilson (28 January 1920 – 18 October 2010) was a British athlete who competed at the 1948 Summer Olympics. In London he competed in the men's 1500m event, but was eliminated in the opening round, placing fifth in his heat. He was born in Islington and was a member of the Polytechnic Harriers of London. In 2008 he was interviewed by the BBC on the subject of the 2012 Summer Olympics that are to be held in London, where he suggested that the organizing committee "should go back to basics, the simplicity of the games". He died in Winchester, Hampshire, England in October 2010.

response: Douglas, Dougie or Doug Wilson may refer to:
* Doug Wilson (Weeds character), fictional character in the television series Weeds, portrayed by actor Kevin Nealon
* Doug Wilson (rugby union) (1931–2019), New Zealand rugby union player
* Doug Wilson (ice hockey) (born 1957), retired professional hockey player, current GM of the San Jose Sharks
* Doug Wilson (racing driver), retired NASCAR Cup Series driver
